segments.text: Ugh, that overflowing sink is disgusting—filthy water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring down the cabinets, making everything soggy and gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's foot in that puddle— who knows what's floating in there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's handling a clean plate while standing in filth; revolting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are in on it, climbing near this mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs in the water— it'll be slippery and contaminated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy's hand in the cookie jar after all this? Cookies will taste like disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Girl reaching toward it—poor things, exposed to this nastiness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks clean, but inside it's a swamp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stacked dishes on the counter, probably getting splashed too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene turns my stomach with its carelessness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dish towel bunched up, likely to get soaked in that crud.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't even look at the widening puddle without cringing.
segments.speaker: PAR
